00021 #if !defined(STATIC_ASSERT)

00028 namespace RandomLib {
00029   /**
00030    * \brief Infinite precision random numbers.
00031    *
00032    * Implement infinite precision random numbers.  Integer part is non-random.
00033    * Fraction part consists of any some number of digits in base
00034    * 2<sup><i>b</i></sup>.  If \e m digits have been generated then the
00035    * fraction is uniformly distributed in the open interval
00036    * sum<sub><i>k</i>=1</sub><sup><i>m</i></sup>
00037    * <i>f</i><sub><i>k</i>-1</sub>/2<sup><i>kb</i></sup> +
00038    * (0,1)/2<sup><i>mb</i></sup>.  When a RandomNumber is first constructed the
00039    * integer part is zero and \e m = 0, and the number represents (0,1).  A
00040    * RandomNumber is able to represent all numbers in the symmetric open
00041    * interval (-2<sup>31</sup>, 2<sup>31</sup>).  In this implementation, \e b
00042    * must one of 1, 2, 3, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 24, 28, or 32.  (This restriction
00043    * allows printing in hexadecimal and can easily be relaxed.  There's also no
00044    * essential reason why the base should be a power of 2.)
00045    *
00046    * @tparam bits the number of bits in each digit.
00047    **********************************************************************/
00048   template<int bits = 1> class RandomNumber {
00049   public:
00050     /**
00051      * Constructor sets number to a random number uniformly distributed in
00052      * \e n + (0,1).
00053      *
00054      * @param[in] n the integer part of the number (default 0).
00055      **********************************************************************/
00056     RandomNumber(int n = 0) : _n(n) {}
00057     /**
00058      * @return the integer part of RandomNumber.
00059      **********************************************************************/
00060     int Integer() const { return _n; }
00061     /**
00062      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00063      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00064      * @param[in] k the index of a digit of the fraction
00065      * @return digit number \e k, generating it if necessary.
00066      **********************************************************************/
00067     template<class Random> unsigned Digit(Random& r, unsigned k) {
00068       ExpandTo(r, k + 1);
00069       return _f[k];
00070     }
00071     /**
00072      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00073      * @param[in] k the index of a digit of the fraction
00074      * @return digit number \e k, without generating new digits.
00075      **********************************************************************/
00076     unsigned RawDigit(unsigned k) const {
00077       return _f.at(k);
00078     }
00079     /**
00080      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00081      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00082      * @return a random digit in [0, 2<sup><i>bits</i></sup>).
00083      **********************************************************************/
00084     template<class Random> static unsigned RandomDigit(Random& r) {
00085       return unsigned(r.template Integer<bits>());
00086     }
00087     /**
00088      * Add integer \e k to RandomNumber.
00089      *
00090      * @param[in] k the integer to add.
00091      **********************************************************************/
00092     void AddInteger(int k) { _n += k; }
00093     /**
00094      * Set integer part of RandomNumber to \e k
00095      *
00096      * @param[in] k the new integer part.
00097      **********************************************************************/
00098     void SetInteger(int k) { _n = k; }
00099     /**
00100      * Set fraction part of RandomNumber to \e n 2<sup><i>-k</i></sup>; only th
00101      * e least significant \e k bits of \e n are used.
00102      *
00103      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00104      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00105      * @param[in] n the bits in the fraction
00106      * @param[in] k the number of bits in the fraction
00107      **********************************************************************/
00108     template<class Random> void SetFraction(Random& r,
00109                                             unsigned n, unsigned k) {
00110       _f.clear();
00111       unsigned
00112         m = (k + bits - 1) / bits, // Number of digits
00113         j = m * bits - k,          //  Number of extra bits needed
00114         u = j > 0 ? (Digit(r, 0) >> (bits - j)) : 0; // The extra bits
00115       n = (n << j) + u;
00116       _f.resize(m);
00117       while (m--) {
00118         _f[m] = n & mask;
00119         n >>= bits < w ? bits : 0;
00120       }
00121     }
00122     /**
00123      * Shift the number left \e k bits (\e k >= 0)
00124      *
00125      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00126      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00127      * @param[in] k the amount to shift by.
00128      **********************************************************************/
00129     template<class Random> void ShiftLeft(Random& r, unsigned k) {
00130       unsigned wshift = k / bits; // Number of whole digits to shift
00131       if (wshift > 0) {
00132         for (unsigned j = 0; j < wshift; ++j) {
00133           _n <<= bits < w ? bits : 0; // Avoid warning when bits == w
00134           _n += Digit(r, j);
00135         }
00136         for (unsigned j = wshift; j < Size(); ++j)
00137           _f[j - wshift] = _f[j];
00138         _f.resize(Size() - wshift);
00139         k -= wshift * bits;       // Remaining bits to shift
00140       }
00141       if (k > 0) {
00142         _n <<= k;
00143         _n += Digit(r, 0) >> (bits - k);
00144         for (unsigned j = 0; j < Size(); ++j)
00145           _f[j] = (mask & (_f[j] << k)) |
00146             ((j + 1 < Size() ? _f[j + 1] : RandomDigit(r)) >> (bits - k)) ;
00147       }
00148     }
00149     /**
00150      * Swap with another RandomNumber
00151      *
00152      * @param[in,out] t the RandomNumber to swap with.
00153      **********************************************************************/
00154     void swap(RandomNumber& t) throw() {
00155       std::swap(_n, t._n);
00156       _f.swap(t._f);
00157     }
00158     /**
00159      * Return to initial state, uniformly distributed in \e n + (0,1).
00160      *
00161      * @param[in] n the integer part of the number (default 0).
00162      **********************************************************************/
00163     void Init(int n = 0) {
00164       STATIC_ASSERT(bits > 0 && bits <= w && (bits < 4 || bits % 4 == 0),
00165                     "RandomNumber: unsupported value for bits");
00166       _n = n;
00167       _f.clear();
00168     }
00169     /**
00170      * Return to initial state, uniformly distributed in \e n + (0,1).  This is
00171      * similar to Init but also returns the memory used by the object to the
00172      * system.  Normally Init should be used.
00173      *
00174      * @param[in] n the integer part of the number (default 0).
00175      **********************************************************************/
00176     void Clear(int n = 0) {
00177       std::vector<unsigned> z(0);
00178       _n = n;
00179       _f.swap(z);
00180     }
00181     /**
00182      * Compare two RandomNumbers, *this < \e t
00183      *
00184      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00185      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00186      * @param[in,out] t a RandomNumber to compare.
00187      * @return true if *this < \e t.
00188      **********************************************************************/
00189     template<class Random> bool LessThan(Random& r, RandomNumber& t) {
00190       if (this == &t)
00191         return false;           // same object
00192       if (_n != t._n)
00193         return _n < t._n;
00194       for (unsigned k = 0; ; ++k) {
00195         // Impose an order on the evaluation of the digits.
00196         const unsigned x = Digit(r,k);
00197         const unsigned y = t.Digit(r,k);
00198         if (x != y)
00199           return x < y;
00200         // Two distinct numbers are never equal
00201       }
00202     }
00203     /**
00204      * Change sign of a RandomNumber
00205      **********************************************************************/
00206     void Negate() {
00207       for (size_t k = 0; k < Size(); ++k)
00208         _f[k] = ~_f[k] & mask;
00209       // Need the -1 shift because the fraction part is always positive
00210       _n = - _n - 1;
00211     }
00212     /**
00213      * @return the number of digits in fraction
00214      **********************************************************************/
00215     unsigned Size() const {
00216       return unsigned(_f.size());
00217     }
00218     /**
00219      * Return the fraction part of the RandomNumber as a floating point number
00220      * of type RealType rounded to the nearest multiple of
00221      * 1/2<sup><i>p</i></sup>, where \e p =
00222      * std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits, and, if necessary, creating
00223      * additional digits of the number.
00224      *
00225      * @tparam RealType the floating point type to convert to.
00226      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00227      * @param[in,out] r a random generator for generating the necessary digits.
00228      * @return the fraction of the RandomNumber rounded to a RealType.
00229      **********************************************************************/
00230     template<typename RealType, typename Random> RealType Fraction(Random& r) {
00231       STATIC_ASSERT(!std::numeric_limits<RealType>::is_integer,
00232                     "RandomNumber::Fraction: invalid real type RealType");
00233       const int d = std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits;
00234       const int k = (d + bits - 1)/bits;
00235       const int kg = (d + bits)/bits; // For guard bit
00236       RealType y = 0;
00237       if (Digit(r, kg - 1) & (1U << (kg * bits - d - 1)))
00238         // if guard bit is set, round up.
00239         y += std::pow(RealType(2), -d);
00240       const RealType fact = std::pow(RealType(2), -bits);
00241       RealType mult = RealType(1);
00242       for (int i = 0; i < k; ++i) {
00243         mult *= fact;
00244         y += mult * RealType(i < k - 1 ? RawDigit(i) :
00245                              RawDigit(i) & (~0U << (k * bits - d)));
00246       }
00247       return y;
00248     }
00249     /**
00250      * Return the value of the RandomNumber rounded to nearest floating point
00251      * number of type RealType and, if necessary, creating additional digits of
00252      * the number.
00253      *
00254      * @tparam RealType the floating point type to convert to.
00255      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00256      * @param[in,out] r a random generator for generating the necessary digits.
00257      * @return the value of the RandomNumber rounded to a RealType.
00258      **********************************************************************/
00259     template<typename RealType, class Random> RealType Value(Random& r) {
00260       // Ignore the possibility of overflow here (OK because int doesn't
00261       // currently overflow any real type).  Assume the real type supports
00262       // denormalized numbers.  Need to treat rounding explicitly since the
00263       // missing digits always imply rounding up.
00264       STATIC_ASSERT(!std::numeric_limits<RealType>::is_integer,
00265                     "RandomNumber::Value: invalid real type RealType");
00266       const int digits = std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits,
00267         min_exp = std::numeric_limits<RealType>::min_exponent;
00268       const bool negative = Integer() < 0;
00269       if (negative)
00270         Negate();
00271       unsigned n = Integer();
00272       int lead;                 // Position of leading bit (0.5 = position 0)
00273       if (n)
00274         lead = highest_bit_idx(n);
00275       else {
00276         int i = 0;
00277         while ( Digit(r, i) == 0 && i < (-min_exp)/bits )
00278           ++i;
00279         lead = highest_bit_idx(RawDigit(i)) - (i + 1) * bits;
00280         // To handle denormalized numbers set lead = max(lead, min_exp)
00281         lead = lead > min_exp ? lead : min_exp;
00282       }
00283       int trail = lead - digits; // Position of guard bit (0.5 = position 0)
00284       RealType y;
00285       if (trail > 0) {
00286         y = RealType(n & (~0U << trail));
00287         if (n & (1U << (trail - 1)))
00288           y += std::pow(RealType(2), trail);
00289       } else {
00290         y = RealType(n);
00291         int k = (-trail)/bits;  // Byte with guard bit
00292         if (Digit(r, k) & (1U << ((k + 1) * bits + trail - 1)))
00293           y += std::pow(RealType(2), trail);
00294         // Byte with trailing bit (can be negative)
00295         k = (-trail - 1 + bits)/bits - 1;
00296         const RealType fact = std::pow(RealType(2), -bits);
00297         RealType mult = RealType(1);
00298         for (int i = 0; i <= k; ++i) {
00299           mult *= fact;
00300           y += mult * RealType(i < k ? RawDigit(i) :
00301                                RawDigit(i) & (~0U << ((k + 1) * bits + trail)));
00302         }
00303       }
00304       if (negative) {
00305         Negate();
00306         y *= -1;
00307       }
00308       return y;
00309     }
00310     /**
00311      * Return the range of possible values for the RandomNumber as pair of
00312      * doubles.  This doesn't create any additional digits of the result and
00313      * doesn't try to control roundoff.
00314      *
00315      * @return a pair denoting the range with first being the lower limit and
00316      *   second being the upper limit.
00317      **********************************************************************/
00318     std::pair<double, double> Range() const {
00319       double y = Integer();
00320       const double fact = std::pow(double(2), -bits);
00321       double mult = double(1);
00322       for (unsigned i = 0; i < Size(); ++i) {
00323         mult *= fact;
00324         y += mult * RawDigit(i);
00325       }
00326       return std::pair<double, double>(y, y + mult);
00327     }
00328 
00329   private:
00330     /**
00331      * The integer part
00332      **********************************************************************/
00333     int _n;
00334     /**
00335      * The fraction part
00336      **********************************************************************/
00337     std::vector<unsigned> _f;
00338     /**
00339      * Fill RandomNumber to \e k digits.
00340      **********************************************************************/
00341     template<class Random> void ExpandTo(Random& r, size_t k) {
00342       size_t l = _f.size();
00343       if (k <= l)
00344         return;
00345       _f.resize(k);
00346       for (size_t i = l; i < k; ++i)
00347         _f[i] = RandomDigit(r);
00348     }
00349     /**
00350      * Return index [0..32] of highest bit set.  Return 0 if x = 0, 32 is if x
00351      * = ~0.  (From Algorithms for programmers by Joerg Arndt.)
00352      **********************************************************************/
00353     static int highest_bit_idx(unsigned x) {
00354       if (x == 0) return 0;
00355       int r = 1;
00356       if (x & 0xffff0000U) { x >>= 16; r += 16; }
00357       if (x & 0x0000ff00U) { x >>=  8; r +=  8; }
00358       if (x & 0x000000f0U) { x >>=  4; r +=  4; }
00359       if (x & 0x0000000cU) { x >>=  2; r +=  2; }
00360       if (x & 0x00000002U) {           r +=  1; }
00361       return r;
00362     }
00363     /**
00364      * The number of bits in unsigned.
00365      **********************************************************************/
00366     static const int w = std::numeric_limits<unsigned>::digits;
00367   public:
00368     /**
00369      * A mask for the digits.
00370      **********************************************************************/
00371     static const unsigned mask =
00372       bits == w ? ~0U : ~(~0U << (bits < w ? bits : 0));
00373   };
00374 
00375   /**
00376    * \relates RandomNumber
00377    * Print a RandomNumber.  Format is n.dddd... where the base for printing is
00378    * 2<sup>max(4,<i>b</i>)</sup>.  The ... represents an infinite sequence of
00379    * ungenerated random digits (uniformly distributed).  Thus with \e b = 1,
00380    * 0.0... = (0,1/2), 0.00... = (0,1/4), 0.11... = (3/4,1), etc.
00381    **********************************************************************/
00382   template<int bits>
00383   std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, const RandomNumber<bits>& n) {
00384     const std::ios::fmtflags oldflags = os.flags();
00385     RandomNumber<bits> t = n;
00386     unsigned i;
00387     if (t.Integer() < 0) {
00388       os << "-";
00389       t.Negate();
00390     }
00391     i = unsigned(t.Integer());
00392     os << std::hex  << std::setfill('0');
00393     if (i == 0)
00394       os << "0";
00395     else {
00396       bool first = true;
00397       const int w = std::numeric_limits<unsigned>::digits;
00398       const unsigned mask = RandomNumber<bits>::mask;
00399       for (int s = ((w + bits - 1)/bits) * bits - bits; s >= 0; s -= bits) {
00400         unsigned d = mask & (i >> s);
00401         if (d || !first) {
00402           if (first) {
00403             os << d;
00404             first = false;
00405           }
00406           else
00407             os << std::setw((bits+3)/4) << d;
00408         }
00409       }
00410     }
00411     os << ".";
00412     unsigned s = t.Size();
00413     for (unsigned i = 0; i < s; ++i)
00414       os << std::setw((bits+3)/4) << t.RawDigit(i);
00415     os << "..." << std::setfill(' ');
00416     os.flags(oldflags);
00417     return os;
00418   }
00419 } // namespace RandomLib
00420 
00421 #endif  // RANDOMLIB_RANDOMNUMBER_HPP
